result.execSummary:
All charges against Theresa M Mazurkiewicz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Theresa M Mazurkiewicz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:28 AM Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Theresa M Mazurkiewicz did not appear.  State moves to dismiss the case without prejudice.  No objection from defense.  Court dismisses case.  Court orders case dismissed without prejudice.
Atty Menden is requesting zoom for 7/13 appearance. Sent to CC Rieck for review

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:41 AM Defendant Theresa M Mazurkiewicz in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz appears as a friend of the Court.  The Court notes Attorney Pablo Galaviz previously represented the defendant.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.
